alert.note: Alert for Coastal St. Johns (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 11:22AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central St. Johns County through 1145 AM EDT... At 1119 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout over the ocean near Ponte Vedra Beach, drifting south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts and winds around 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects especially on the beaches. Beware of lightning hazards especially on the beaches and golf courses. Locations impacted include... Ponte Vedra Beach, Palm Valley, and Sawgrass. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
